ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Schwannoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Supported by asymmetric SNHL, 0% speech recognition in the right ear, absent ABR waveforms, and MRI confirmation of an enhancing mass in the right IAC.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial consideration for SNHL, but ruled out by disproportionately poor speech recognition, absent acoustic reflexes, and absent ABR waveforms.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech recognition abilities and check for retrocochlear signs (poor recognition).
To screen for retrocochlear pathology; absence or decay suggests neural involvement.
To assess neural integrity and rule out retrocochlear pathology given the asymmetry.
Gold standard imaging to visualize the internal auditory canal and confirm presence of a tumor.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiological evaluation revealed asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, significantly worse in the right ear. Speech recognition was disproportionately poor (0%) in the right ear compared to the left. Acoustic reflexes were absent in the right ear. These findings are highly suggestive of retrocochlear pathology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Slight SNHL at 250 Hz, sloping to moderate (500-2000 Hz), rising to mild. Right ear: Severe SNHL (250-1000 Hz), rising to moderately severe.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left SRT 40 dB HL, WRS 88%. Right SAT 65 dB HL, WRS 0%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Present but elevated/absent at highs. Right ear: Absent at all frequencies.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: ABR testing was performed to rule out retrocochlear pathology. Results showed absent waveforms on the right side, consistent with auditory nerve or brainstem dysfunction, while the left side was normal.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Normal absolute and interpeak latencies. Right ear: All waveforms absent.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: MRI scan confirmed the presence of a retrocochlear lesion. A vestibular schwannoma was identified in the right Internal Auditory Canal.

tests.name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
tests.result_summary: Enhancing mass filling superior and inferior compartments of the right Internal Auditory Canal (IAC), consistent with a solitary vestibular schwannoma.

proposed_items: Continue use of left BiCROS hearing aid
Hearing Assistive Technologies (HATs) such as personal FM system and amplified phone
Hearing protection for the better (left) ear
Annual MRI monitoring of the tumor
Intratympanic gentamicin injections for vestibular hypofunction
Surgical resection of schwannoma (if imbalance persists)
counseling_actions: Counsel on the diagnosis of vestibular schwannoma and its impact on hearing and balance
Explain that standard amplification will not help the right ear due to poor speech recognition
Discuss the benefits of BiCROS amplification for routing sound from the poor ear to the better ear
Advise on the importance of protecting the better ear from noise exposure
Counsel on realistic expectations regarding balance issues and potential treatments

red_flags_present: Disproportionately poor speech recognition (0%) in one ear

escalation.rationale_short: For medical management and monitoring of the confirmed vestibular schwannoma and treatment of vestibular symptoms.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds, speech recognition, and tumor size via MRI.

expected_outcome: Patient A successfully uses a left BiCROS hearing aid and follows up for maintenance.
Vestibular examination revealed hypofunction of the right vestibular system.
Patient received two intratympanic gentamicin injections to stabilize right hypofunction.
Otologist recommends complete surgical resection if significant imbalance continues.
Tumor is being monitored with annual MRI scans.
